title: Authors and Citation
text: Catala M, Mercadé-Besora N (2024). visOmopResults: Format summarisedResult objects gt flextable objects. R package version 0.0.1, https://oxford-pharmacoepi.github.io/visOmopResults/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {visOmopResults: Format summarisedResult objects into gt and flextable objects},   author = {Marti Catala and Núria Mercadé-Besora},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://oxford-pharmacoepi.github.io/visOmopResults/}, }

title: Format summarisedResult objects into gt and flextable objects
text: VisOmop contains functions formatting objects class summarised_result compared_result (see R package omopgenerics). package simplifies handling objects obtain nice output tables format gt flextable’ report results via Shiny apps, RMarkdown, Quarto, .

title: Format summarisedResult objects into gt and flextable objects
text: can install development version VisOmop GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("oxford-pharmacoepi/VisOmop")

title: Format summarisedResult objects into gt and flextable objects
text: example show use package format mock summarised_result object nice gt object. First load package create mock summarised_result object.
code: library(VisOmop) library(dplyr) result <- mockSummarisedResult()

title: Format summarisedResult objects into gt and flextable objects
text: utilize formatEstimateValue function modify estimate_value column. case, apply default settings function, include using 0 decimals integer values, 2 decimals numeric values, 1 decimal percentages, 3 decimals proportions. Additionally, function sets decimal mark ‘.’, thousand/millions separator ‘,’ default.”
code: result <- result %>% formatEstimateValue()

title: Format summarisedResult objects into gt and flextable objects
text: formatEstimateName function enables transformation estimate_name estimate_value columns. example, allows consolidate one row counts percentages related variable within group strata. ’s worth noting estimate_name enclosed within <…> estimateNameFormat argument.”
code: result <- result %>% formatEstimateName(   estimateNameFormat = c("N (%)" = "<count> (<percentage>%)",                          "N" = "<count>",                          "Mean (SD)" = "<mean> (<sd>)"),   keepNotFormatted = FALSE)

title: Format summarisedResult objects into gt and flextable objects
code: result <- result %>%   spanHeader(header = c("Study cohorts", "group_level", "Study strata",                          "strata_name", "strata_level"),              delim = "\n",               includeHeaderName = FALSE)

title: Format summarisedResult objects into gt and flextable objects
code: result <- result %>%   gtTable(     delim = "\n",     style = list("header" = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#c8c8c8"),                                  gt::cell_text(weight = "bold")),       "header_name" = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#d9d9d9"),                            gt::cell_text(weight = "bold")),       "header_level" = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#e1e1e1"),                             gt::cell_text(weight = "bold")),       "column_name" = list(gt::cell_text(weight = "bold")),       "group_label" = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#e9ecef"),                            gt::cell_text(weight = "bold")),       "title" = list(gt::cell_text(color = "blue", weight = "bold")     ),     na = "-",     title = "My first gt table with VisOmop!),     groupNameCol = "group_level",     groupNameAsColumn = FALSE,     groupOrder = c("cohort1", "cohort2")     )

what: Format estimate_name and estimate_value column — formatEstimateName
title: Format estimate_name and estimate_value column — formatEstimateName
text: Format estimate_name estimate_value column summarised_result compared_result object, changing name estimate name /joining diferent estimate names together row.

title: Format estimate_name and estimate_value column — formatEstimateName
code: formatEstimateName(result, estimateNameFormat = NULL, keepNotFormatted = TRUE)

title: Format estimate_name and estimate_value column — formatEstimateName
text: result summarised_result compared_result. estimateNameFormat Named list estimate name's join, sorted computation order. Indicate estimate_name's <...>. keepNotFormatted Whether keep rows formatted.

title: Format estimate_name and estimate_value column — formatEstimateName
text: summarised_result object withspecified changes estimate_name estimate_value.

title: Format estimate_name and estimate_value column — formatEstimateName
code: # \donttest{ result <- mockSummarisedResult() result |> formatEstimateName(     estimateNameFormat = c("N (%)" = "<count> (<percentage>%)",                            "N" = "<count>"),     keepNotFormatted = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 36 × 15 #>    cdm_name result_type package_name   package_version group_name  group_level #>    <chr>    <chr>       <chr>          <chr>           <chr>       <chr>       #>  1 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  2 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  3 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  4 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  5 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  6 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  7 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  8 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  9 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #> 10 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort2     #> # ℹ 26 more rows #> # ℹ 9 more variables: strata_name <chr>, strata_level <chr>, #> #   variable_name <chr>, variable_level <chr>, estimate_name <chr>, #> #   estimate_type <chr>, estimate_value <chr>, additional_name <chr>, #> #   additional_level <chr> # }

title: Format the estimate_value column — formatEstimateValue
text: Format estimate_value column summarised_result compared_result object editing number decimals, decimal thousand/millions separator marks.

title: Format the estimate_value column — formatEstimateValue
code: formatEstimateValue(   result,   decimals = c(integer = 0, numeric = 2, percentage = 1, proportion = 3),   decimalMark = ".",   bigMark = "," )

title: Format the estimate_value column — formatEstimateValue
text: result summarised_result compared_result. decimals Number decimals per estimate_type (integer, numeric, percentage, proportion). decimalMark Decimal separator mark. bigMark Thousand millions separator mark.

title: Format the estimate_value column — formatEstimateValue
text: summarised_result object estimate_value column formatted.

title: Format the estimate_value column — formatEstimateValue
code: # \donttest{ result <- mockSummarisedResult()  result |> formatEstimateValue(decimals = 1) #> # A tibble: 90 × 15 #>    cdm_name result_type package_name   package_version group_name  group_level #>    <chr>    <chr>       <chr>          <chr>           <chr>       <chr>       #>  1 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  2 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  3 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  4 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  5 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  6 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  7 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  8 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  9 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #> 10 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort2     #> # ℹ 80 more rows #> # ℹ 9 more variables: strata_name <chr>, strata_level <chr>, #> #   variable_name <chr>, variable_level <chr>, estimate_name <chr>, #> #   estimate_type <chr>, estimate_value <chr>, additional_name <chr>, #> #   additional_level <chr>  result |> formatEstimateValue(decimals = c(integer = 0, numeric = 1)) #> # A tibble: 90 × 15 #>    cdm_name result_type package_name   package_version group_name  group_level #>    <chr>    <chr>       <chr>          <chr>           <chr>       <chr>       #>  1 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  2 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  3 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  4 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  5 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  6 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  7 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  8 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #>  9 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort1     #> 10 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name cohort2     #> # ℹ 80 more rows #> # ℹ 9 more variables: strata_name <chr>, strata_level <chr>, #> #   variable_name <chr>, variable_level <chr>, estimate_name <chr>, #> #   estimate_type <chr>, estimate_value <chr>, additional_name <chr>, #> #   additional_level <chr> # }

what: Creats a tibble with specific rows pivotted into columns — formatTable
title: Creats a tibble with specific rows pivotted into columns — formatTable
text: Pivots summarised_result object based column names header. names new columns refer information column based header input, labels separated using delimiter.

title: Creats a tibble with specific rows pivotted into columns — formatTable
code: formatTable(   result,   header,   delim = "\n",   includeHeaderName = TRUE,   includeHeaderKey = TRUE )

title: Creats a tibble with specific rows pivotted into columns — formatTable
text: result summarised_result compared_result. header Names columns make headers. Names corresponding column table result, used headers defined position. delim Delimiter use separate headers. includeHeaderName Wheather include column name header. includeHeaderKey Wheather include header key (header, header_name, header_level) header type column name.

title: Creats a tibble with specific rows pivotted into columns — formatTable
text: tibble rows pivotted columns column names future spanner headers.

title: Creats a tibble with specific rows pivotted into columns — formatTable
code:
# \donttest{ result <- mockSummarisedResult()  result |>   formatTable(header = c("Study cohorts", "group_level", "Study strata",                          "strata_name", "strata_level"),               includeHeaderName = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 5 × 29 #>   cdm_name result_type package_name   package_version group_name  variable_name  #>   <chr>    <chr>       <chr>          <chr>           <chr>       <chr>          #> 1 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name number subjec… #> 2 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name age            #> 3 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name age            #> 4 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name Medications    #> 5 mock     NA          visOmopResults 0.0.1           cohort_name Medications    #> # ℹ 23 more variables: variable_level <chr>, estimate_name <chr>, #> #   estimate_type <chr>, additional_name <chr>, additional_level <chr>, #> #   `[header]Study cohorts
[header_level]cohort1
[header]Study strata
[header_level]overall
[header_level]overall` <chr>, #> #   `[header]Study cohorts
[header_level]cohort1
[header]Study strata
[header_level]age_group and sex
[header_level]<40 and Male` <chr>, #> #   `[header]Study cohorts
[header_level]cohort1
[header]Study strata
[header_level]age_group and sex
[header_level]>=40 and Male` <chr>, #> #   `[header]Study cohorts
[header_level]cohort1
[header]Study strata
[header_level]age_group and sex
[header_level]<40 and Female` <chr>, #> #   `[header]Study cohorts
[header_level]cohort1
[header]Study strata
[header_level]age_group and sex
[header_level]>=40 and Female` <chr>, … # }

what: Creats a flextable object from a dataframe — fxTable
title: Creats a flextable object from a dataframe — fxTable
text: Creats flextable object dataframe using delimiter (delim) span header, specified styles different parts table.

title: Creats a flextable object from a dataframe — fxTable
code: fxTable(   x,   delim = "\n",   style = list(header = list(cell = officer::fp_cell(background.color = "#c8c8c8"), text     = officer::fp_text(bold = TRUE)), header_name = list(cell =     officer::fp_cell(background.color = "#d9d9d9"), text = officer::fp_text(bold =     TRUE)), header_level = list(cell = officer::fp_cell(background.color = "#e1e1e1"),     text = officer::fp_text(bold = TRUE)), column_name = list(text =     officer::fp_text(bold = TRUE)), group_label = list(cell =     officer::fp_cell(background.color = "#e9ecef"), text = officer::fp_text(bold =     TRUE))),   na = "-",   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   caption = NULL,   groupNameCol = NULL,   groupNameAsColumn = FALSE,   groupOrder = NULL )

title: Creats a flextable object from a dataframe — fxTable
text: x dataframe. delim Delimiter. style Named list specifies style different parts flextable. Accepted entries : title, subtitle, header, header_name, header_level, column_name, group_label, body. na display missing values. title Title table, NULL title. subtitle Subtitle table, NULL subtitle. caption Caption table, NULL caption. Text markdown formatting style (e.g. *caption * caption italics). groupNameCol Column use group labels. groupNameAsColumn Whether display group labels column (TRUE) rows (FALSE). groupOrder Order display group labels.

title: Creats a flextable object from a dataframe — fxTable
text: flextable object flextable.

title: Creats a flextable object from a dataframe — fxTable

what: Creats a gt object from a dataframe — gtTable
title: Creats a gt object from a dataframe — gtTable
text: Creats gt object dataframe using delimiter (delim) span header, specified styles different parts table.

title: Creats a gt object from a dataframe — gtTable
code: gtTable(   x,   delim = "\n",   style = list(header = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#c8c8c8"), gt::cell_text(weight =     "bold")), header_name = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#d9d9d9"), gt::cell_text(weight =     "bold")), header_level = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#e1e1e1"), gt::cell_text(weight     = "bold")), column_name = list(gt::cell_text(weight = "bold")), group_label =     list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#e9ecef"), gt::cell_text(weight = "bold"))),   na = "-",   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   caption = NULL,   groupNameCol = NULL,   groupNameAsColumn = FALSE,   groupOrder = NULL )

title: Creats a gt object from a dataframe — gtTable
text: x dataframe. delim Delimiter. style Named list specifies style different parts gt table. Accepted entries : title, subtitle, header, header_name, header_level, column_name, group_label, body. na display missing values. title Title table, NULL title. subtitle Subtitle table, NULL subtitle. caption Caption table, NULL caption. Text markdown formatting style (e.g. *caption * caption italics). groupNameCol Column use group labels. groupNameAsColumn Whether display group labels column (TRUE) rows (FALSE). groupOrder Order display group labels.

title: Creats a gt object from a dataframe — gtTable
text: gt object gt table.

title: Creats a gt object from a dataframe — gtTable
code:
# \donttest{ mockSummarisedResult() |> formatEstimateValue(decimals = c(integer = 0, numeric = 1)) |> formatTable(header = c("Study strata", "strata_level"), includeHeaderName = FALSE) |> gtTable( style = list("header" = list( gt::cell_fill(color = "#d9d9d9"), gt::cell_text(weight = "bold")), "header_level" = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#e1e1e1"), gt::cell_text(weight = "bold")), "column_name" = list(gt::cell_text(weight = "bold")), "title" = list(gt::cell_text(weight = "bold"), gt::cell_fill(color = "#c8c8c8")), "group_label" = gt::cell_fill(color = "#e1e1e1")), na = "--", title = "gtTable example", subtitle = NULL, caption = NULL, groupNameCol = "group_level", groupNameAsColumn = FALSE, groupOrder = c("cohort1", "cohort2") ) #>

title: visOmopResults: Format summarisedResult objects into gt and flextable objects — visOmopResults-package
text: Maintainer: Marti Catala marti.catalasabate@ndorms.ox.ac.uk (ORCID) Authors: Núria Mercadé-Besora nuria.mercadebesora@ndorms.ox.ac.uk (ORCID)
